metadata.title: CVE-2010-3690 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpCAS before 1.1.3,when proxy mode is enabled, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary webscript or HTML via (1) a crafted Proxy Granting Ticket IOU (PGTiou)parameter to the callback function in client.php, (2) vectors involvingfunctions that make getCallbackURL calls, or (3) vectors involvingfunctions that make getURL calls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glpi - 0.80.7-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

moodle - 1.9.9.dfsg2-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glpi package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.80.7-1').
moodle package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.9.dfsg2-5').
